# Introduction
Compilation of raw data. 

# Data
# Joint model

Loading data 
```{r}
rm(list=ls(all=TRUE))
# Load settings
source('r-code/00_settings.R')


# load data & libraries - Loading Raw data file without average of ill a ntot of White Plague - made July 11-Andia 
White <- read.csv("data/Rawdata_WP_No_average_Rainmm.csv", header = TRUE) #Rainfall in mm and not average data for diseased (ill or ntot, this to avoid adding more variability, as we discuss with Bernd)

#check data
ls(White)
dim(White)
head(White)

#Save data as rdata file to avoid changing this data in the future
save(White,file="data/White_rawdata1.rdata")
```

Once this file is saved, I used in the Whiteplague_working data Rmarkdown script to modify it and sclae/ transform data without
changing the original rawdata.
